data.name: Medicare Frequently Asked Questions
data.text: You may have any concerns if you or a loved one has just signed up for Medicare or is hoping to sign up soon. Those issues may include: What's covered by Medicare? What Medicare coverage is going to cover my prescription medication? How much would it be for my monthly Medicare expenses?

data.name: What's the Difference between Medicare and Medicaid?
data.text: Medicare and Medicaid are U.S. government-sponsored services intended to help American citizens pay healthcare costs. These two programs, founded in 1965 and subsidized by taxpayers, have similar-sounding names, which may create confusion about how they operate and the coverage they provide.

data.name: Get to know the basics of Medicare Supplement Insurance
data.text: Medicare Supplement Insurance, also known as Medigap, is an alternative or adds on to Original Medicare (Part A and B) private health insurance. It helps pay for 20 percent of the costs of Medicare not covered by Original Medicare.

data.name: What will it Cost You When you Join Medicare?
data.text: Medicare Part A (Hospital Insurance) is largely funded by a percentage tax on wages earned by employers and workers. Higher-income taxpayers pay a higher payroll tax on earnings (more than $200,000 / individual and $250,000 / pair).

data.name: How to Choose a Health Insurance Plan in 4 Easy Steps
data.text: Time is usually limited to find the right health insurance package for your family, but it can be expensive to hurry and you may choose the wrong one. Here's a guide on how to choose a health insurance plan for your family.
